comment: The main thing I learned from this class is that these negative reviews are mostly from people who literally just don't study. If you put an hour each day for this class and keep up with deadlines, you will be fine. He's a bit disorganized, sure, but this class is manageable. It's a hard class, expect difficulty.

Don't be alarmed by the other reviews. As an average student, I still managed to enjoy Professor Scott's class. The content is relatively easy but the tests/exams can prove difficult if you don't put in the time/effort into studying. Attend his office hours and ask plenty of questions. If you're a self-starter this is the class for you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Very lazy professor who does not communicate. No emails routinely sent to the class, he just uploads prerecorded lectures and goes dark for months. Multiple emails asking for help or clarification went unanswered. Long 90 question exams due on Sundays, with one even due on Easter. Massive pain for those of us who travel and are busy on weekends.

Mr. Scott is an intelligent being & practices what he preaches. I can't lie he does leave out bits of info in lectures, but can be found in the highlighted text in the chapter you need. However, these lectures are toooooo good to not save for yourself in the future. Attendance isn't mandatory but definitely show up to ASK QUESTIONS! 4 exams 1 final

Terrible. Assigned all our exams to only be open on Sunday's and they are all 90 questions. Even gave us a test on Easter. All homework assignments around 100-200 questions long, and several times made review exams only available Saturday and closes it at midnight. Just absolutely awful, makes a relatively easy class difficult.
The content is really difficult but this guy is hilarious

Absolutely terrible. Gave 90 question tests that could only be taken on Sunday's. Would assign reviews that were only open on Saturday. Puts ab 60 slides of info in a 45 min lecture vid. Also nobody heard from him for about a month lmao. Just awful do NOT waste your time in his class.

It's not easy, but it's a managable course. Most of these bad reviews are just students who don't know how to study lmfao. His provided lectures are decent and insightful sometimes, but honestly you're better off just reading the highlighted notes.

Tests are lockdown browser, 90 questions in 2 hours. Take your time with the tests, and study!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: The best professors I've ever had in my entire college career. Your grade will reflect on how you study. Professor Scott will make it clear what to do to succeed and when you carry over the work ethic that he teaches in this course to other courses, you'll make the most out of this class.

I stopped attending class pretty early on. But, I still passed with a high 80. As the reviews say, it was pretty disorganized. However, that was mostly due to the fact that he adapted and changed things based on feedback. Overall, it was an easy class. Exams were mostly scenario questions so do the optional scenario activities.

He is hands down my all time favorite professor. I don't understand the low ratings. If you are lazy or immature, then he may not be for you. He is extremely inspirational and instilled the importance of academic excellence. His lectures are very engaging and he genuinely cares about the success of every one of his students. I highly recommend him!

Professor Scott did a great job teaching business law while making the class entertaining. He shared many interesting stories about various cases he had worked on or heard about, demonstrated he cared about the information he was teaching, and gave multiple inspirational lectures about the importance of working hard. A+ professor!

Great guy he is pretty cool. His lectures are very informative and he does kahoots in class to help the class understand the material. The exams are 90 questions but as long as you study you will get a good grade. There is lots of homework. If you do the exams study guides and read the text book you will pass. Overall I would definitely recommend.

The lack of structure, changes to formats & assignment windows, issues with D2L access, & unclear grading, made an already difficult class that much harder. Most of the work is time consuming. Otherwise easy 100s were missed due to this lack of consistency. His lectures are great; I learned a lot but idk if my grade will reflect that.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Disorganized teaching method, doesn't follow his syllabus. Assignments not linked properly in D2L without correct due dates and he changes due dates as he feels. Doesn't always respond to emails promptly. Does provide extra credit opportunities/makeups for the exams but is very hesitant and indecisive. Each test was different. Too much stress!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy

comment: This is an easy class if you are willing to put in the work by actually studying for the exams. For the McGraw-Hill assignments, you can get a 100 since it is unlimited takes. However, the exam questions can be quite wordy. That being said, Professor Scott adapted the test structure from the feedback given. Read the textbook if you are struggling.

Lots of homework and reading. Nice professor and very experienced in his field of study, also explains things well. Just needs better D2L organization. The material is hard no matter which professor you take. Exam questions are lengthy with lots of conceptual questions so be ready to really read and understand the material.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Noticeably a first-time professor, kept changing how we did the tests, but for the better for students. 3 tests and a final. McGraw work is a lot but super easy, but tests are tough if you don't study, read the text and attend lectures. Get 100% on all assignments (which isnt hard) and decent on tests, and you can get an A. gives extra credit.

The teacher isn't too bad but it more the material. The class is naturally hard and I think he just wants everyone to know the material. There are 90+ questions on Exam. He uses Lockdown browser+ Webcam. These other reviews are very dramatic and blowing it out of proportion.

The class is hard because of how much material you learn. The main thing is for the exams he'll say to study certain stuff specifically like exam reviews but on the exam the questions aren't the same. I personally would never take him again because of how unorganized he is but the class is doable you just have to study the textbook & lectures.
I won't deny, it was a challenging class but I'd doable if you put in the work! There is a lot of “hate” towards him but that isn't deserved. He is very smart and definitely cares about his students!

Very caring and passionate, and he knows his stuff and is a nice guy, but he's just not a great prof. He struggles to stick to the syllabus, doesn't take criticism well, and his exams in particular are extremely difficult. The other reviews are a bit dramatic, hes nowhere near the worst prof, but if you have other options id pick them instead.
He is a nice guy, a lawyer in fact, but the course is challenging. He certainly knows the BLAW material but you'll have to study for sure!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: tests are always gonna be 90+ questions, 60% of the class usually fails the tests, lectures can get boring get ready for lots of useless work because he will decide to change his mind on what the test covers! good luck!

He's not as bad as people are saying, I swear LOL. He is very lecture-heavy.However, homework and quizzes are online and easy. You can do both at home, and there's no lockdown.The big issue was him figuring out how to do exams because everyone wasn't doing well. He has been working with us, which is good, but he has some work to do.Hes a good guy.
He's not the worst but not the best, a pretty alright class
L professor. bro constantly crashes out and his test are like 100 questions. hes my biggest opp

I would honestly say worst professor I have had. His test is 90 questions with no note card. He constantly changes his schedule and tells you one thing one day and the next day changes it. Does not respond to emails. Completely lost his head when 70+ % of the class failed the test.   Test is are difficult as he tries to trick you with wording.

A student asked him a very simple question about using a notecard on the exam, and he completely crashed out stating that students dont want to put in the work to pass. That should' tell you everything you need to know about this guy. RUNNNNN FROM THIS MAN AT ALL COSTS!!

Please NEVER take this professor. Not only does he completely deviate from the syllabus, but he's very inconsistent, never keeps promises made to students, cannot take feedback, most of the time doesn't post lecture slides, or provide any study guides. He posts exam reviews but they are very different from the exam. Worst teacher I've ever had!!!!

I stopped attending class after the first month. I took my notes from the textbook and did well on the assignments/tests. He was unorganized but I believe it's because he was new this year. There are 90 question tests, but most the questions are basic and repetitive. Professor has his downsides, but my class was also a little dramatic. Just study.

um just don't. that's all i can say. 90q tests that everyone fails, random case studies in class, inconsistent assignments and due dates. he's nice to a certain extent, but i've never met a professor like him. not in a good way
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Test heavy

comment: Unlike what a lot of these reviews say, this professor is actually nice and pretty helpful. The reason a lot of these reviews are bad is because the class is hard. You'll have to attend lectures and read the textbooks. Other than that, the professor tells interesting stories from his career and creates a fun class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This professor is tough and gives a reality into the real business world. Although he is unorganized at times he places high expectations onto his students in hopes to help them succeed. If you read the book and study the notes you will do fine, you just have to have a solid knowledge of the information to go into the tests, it is 90 questions
just terrible
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: If I could give this professor a zero, I would have. Everybody in the class was miserable, and never knew what was coming due to the lack of organization. The exams are made in order for you to fail. He does not care about his students success.

Great professor, the class and material he teaches is difficult though. He genuinely cares for his students and will push you. He does speak fast, but previewing material before class will counteract this. Don't listen to the other reviews here, its a genuine skill issue. Put in work and you will succeed. Also has a pretty pure golf swing.

He is a VERY engaging professor and makes his lectures somewhat interesting. But the CONS outweighs the pros. He makes each test 90 questions and still more than HALF of the class fails it. The organization of this class is a mess and you never know when the assignments are actually do. He also does not listen to his students either. DO NOT TAKE!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Nice guy but, You have to STUDY. Study the actual material, what it means, and how it applies. He is a lawyer himself & is VERY passionate about the material. If you're going into law then I'd recommend it, if you don't care about the course bc it doesn't matter to your degree, then don't take it unless you plan on becoming a better student.
HE IS SO BAD OMG.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Everything they said and more

Poor organization and unreasonable expectations. The exams were impossible, with only 60 minutes for 90 questions, resulting in over half the class failing without any grading curve applied. Assignment due dates were unclear, and the syllabus did not match the actual assignments. Syllabus is extremely vague and does not provide insight on grading.

More interested in his golf swing than teaching the class. Moves through slides way too fast, so you have to read the lectures before class. Answers in vague legalease. Tests are 90 questions. Doesn't say in class when certain assignments are die

Had high hopes for this professor but it was the biggest mistake of my life. When students ask him questions in his class, his responses are pretty vague. The D2L for his class is an absolute mess and its very unclear when assignments are due. The syllabus doesn't follow the HW due dates. 1st exam was so insane probably harder than the bar exam.

The professor is knowledgeable in his stuff but is careless about his students. 61% failed the first test and he blames the students. Test are ridiculous, and the study material given does not help a bit. Do not recommend this professor at all, please wait and find another one.

He's a cool guy and all but the way he organizes the class is awful. He gave us multiple assignments including 4 practice exams that I got a 100 on all. The 90-question exam we all took, only 1% got an A and over 60% failed. The class itself isn't supposed to be too hard, it's a professor issue if the grades are looking like this.
Worst professor I've ever had at KSU. 90 question exams with 60 minutes to complete. Honestly, he should be reported to the dean. Never takes feedback from students. Please don't take this professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Randomly will assign 5 things due on one day without following the class schedule, doesn't answer any emails and provides tests that are impossible to pass.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: This is quite possibly the worst professor I have ever had, and the worst professor in the entirety of Kennesaw state. His tests are "at least 90 questions", test material is insane, and whenever we asked if he would curve or make them less questions he lectured us on responsibility. I do not recommend anyone to ever take this professor.
Each unit test is 90 questions with only an hour to complete, no study guide for the test. Due dates are not clear. Do not recommend this Professor.

90-question test for each of the 4 exams and you only get 60 minutes for each in-person exam, I'd rather wait a semester to take BLAW than be in this guy's class again. 61% failed the first test and he's blaming the class and all the other sections did worse. 13% got Bs 3% got As No curve for the exam. DO NOT TAKE

Although most would say Professor Scott is tough, he is a great teacher that gives insight to the reality of a business lawyer. He allows students to not only express their opinions through lectures and involves spirited debates throughout the classes, but to also learn how to stand firm in their opinions.
